intro: Heteropterys pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered heteropterys, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of South America. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. Heteropterys pauciflora is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
